Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the expulsion officer erred in refusing to defer removal and failed to consider the best interests of the applicant's child
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant's husband was deported due to criminal activity; applicant sought deferral of her removal order based on humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) grounds and child's best interests
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refusal to defer removal was not patently unreasonable
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Husband engaged in criminal activity leading to deportation
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Best interests of Canadian-born child, H&C considerations
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Best interests of the child, pending H&C application, risk upon return
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly challenged; focus on procedural compliance
Crimes.Evidence_Used: PRRA application, H&C claims, child welfare considerations
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds, family unity
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Officer considered child’s best interests and H&C claims
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Section 48 of IRPA mandates immediate enforcement unless stayed
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No new evidence or substantiated risks presented
Crimes.Outcome: Removal not deferred; judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential separation from child, return to Albania
Crimes.Cause_Description: Husband's deportation due to criminal activity; applicant seeking relief based on family ties
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: H&C application claimed lost but not verified as error
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA s.48 – failure to meet criteria for deferral
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of timely submission or verification of H&C application
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer found no impediment to removal
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No legal barrier to removal; child's best interest considered but outweighed by enforcement mandate
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA), Immigration Division
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Unsubstantiated claims of risk and lost application

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the expulsion officer erred in refusing to defer removal and failed to consider the best interests of the applicant's child
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Post-removal order, H&C application allegedly lost
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims of abuse and lost application deemed unsubstantiated
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Affidavits, H&C application records, PRRA submissions
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Risk from abusive spouse, best interests of child, lost H&C application
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credible evidence supporting risk or procedural error
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: IRPA s.48 – enforcement of removal orders
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None found; officer reviewed available information
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Procedural fairness and consideration of child's best interests
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s.48 – immediate removal unless impracticable
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Credibility issues, lack of corroborating evidence, no proven error in processing
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to prove loss of application or substantiate abuse claims
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Officer considered all relevant factors including child's best interests
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Alleged misrepresentation through omission or false statements
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Procedural unfairness, failure to consider H&C factors
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and handling of H&C application
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to properly submit or retain H&C application

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the expulsion officer erred in refusing to defer removal and failed to consider the best interests of the applicant's child
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant remained in Canada after visa expiry and refugee claim rejection; sought deferral due to personal risks and Canadian-born child
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Deferral of removal based on H&C grounds
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada beyond authorized period
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Family ties, risk upon return, best interests of child
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Child’s best interests, validity of H&C application, risk assessment
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims of risk and lost H&C application not sufficiently supported
Crimes.Evidence_Used: PRRA rejection, H&C application status, child custody considerations
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Officer acknowledged but did not find compelling evidence for deferral
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Removal must occur as soon as reasonably practicable
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No valid or pending H&C application, lack of corroboration for risks
Crimes.Cause_Description: Overstay following rejected refugee claim; request for deferral based on child and safety concerns
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: H&C application reportedly lost; no confirmation of error
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA s.48 – unauthorized presence and enforceable removal order
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Enforcement priority under IRPA; child's best interest considered but not determinative
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lost or missing H&C application, lack of evidence on risks

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Protection from abuse, immigration deferral based on victimization
Crimes.Location_of_Incident: Private residence, Canada and/or country of origin
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: History of abuse, vulnerability of single parent with child
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Not applicable to applicant; perpetrator may have history
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Affidavits, police reports (if any), medical records, witness statements
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Questioned due to lack of documentation
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Risk to applicant and child upon return
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – based on gender and familial relationship
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Canadian federal immigration and protection system
Crimes.Legal_Framework: IRPA, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (implied)
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities for H&C claims
Crimes.Outcome: Removal not deferred; judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Timing of evidence submission, adequacy of H&C application
